t: Jeremiah 6
Jerusalem Under Siege

“Flee*pn for safety, people of Benjamin! Flee*ld from Jerusalem! Sound*ln the trumpet in Tekoa! Raise*ld the signal over Beth Hakkerem! For*ln disaster looms out of the north, even*ld terrible destruction.
I*ln will destroy Daughter Zion, so*ld beautiful and delicate.
Shepherds*ln with their flocks will come against her; they*ld will pitch their tents around her, each*ld tending his own portion.”
“Prepare*pn for battle against her! Arise,*ld let us attack at noon! But,*ln alas, the daylight is fading, and*ld the shadows of evening grow long.
So*ln arise, let us attack at night and*ld destroy her fortresses!”
This*p is what the Lord*s Almighty says: “Cut*pn down the trees and*ld build siege ramps against Jerusalem. This*ln city must be punished; it*ld is filled with oppression.
As*ln a well pours out its water, so*ld she pours out her wickedness. Violence*ln and destruction resound in her; her*ld sickness and wounds are ever before me.
Take*ln warning, Jerusalem, or*ld I will turn away from you and*ln make your land desolate so*ld no one can live in it.”
This*p is what the Lord*s Almighty says: “Let*pn them glean the remnant of Israel as*ld thoroughly as a vine; pass*ln your hand over the branches again, like*ld one gathering grapes.”
To*pn whom can I speak and give warning? Who*ld will listen to me? Their*ln ears are closed so*ld they cannot hear. The*ln word of the Lord*s is offensive to them; they*ld find no pleasure in it.

But*ln I am full of the wrath of the Lord,*s and*ld I cannot hold it in. “Pour*pn it out on the children in the street and*ld on the young men gathered together; both*ln husband and wife will be caught in it, and*ld the old, those weighed down with years.
Their*ln houses will be turned over to others, together*ld with their fields and their wives, when*ln I stretch out my hand against*ld those who live in the land,” declares*ld the Lord.*s
“From*pn the least to the greatest, all*ld are greedy for gain; prophets*ln and priests alike, all*ld practice deceit.
They*ln dress the wound of my people as*ld though it were not serious. ‘Peace,*ln peace,’ they say, when*ld there is no peace.

Are*ln they ashamed of their detestable conduct? No,*ld they have no shame at all; they*ld do not even know how to blush. So*ln they will fall among the fallen; they*ld will be brought down when I punish them,” says*ld the Lord.*s

This*p is what the Lord*s says: “Stand*pn at the crossroads and look; ask*ld for the ancient paths, ask*ln where the good way is, and walk in it, and*ld you will find rest for your souls. But*ld you said, ‘We will not walk in it.’
I*ln appointed watchmen over you and said, ‘Listen*ld to the sound of the trumpet!’ But*ld you said, ‘We will not listen.’
Therefore*ln hear, you nations; you*ld who are witnesses, observe*ld what will happen to them.
Hear,*ln you earth: I*ld am bringing disaster on this people, the*ld fruit of their schemes, because*ln they have not listened to my words and*ld have rejected my law.
What*ln do I care about incense from Sheba or*ld sweet calamus from a distant land? Your*ln burnt offerings are not acceptable; your*ld sacrifices do not please me.”
Therefore*p this is what the Lord*s says: “I*pn will put obstacles before this people. Parents*ld and children alike will stumble over them; neighbors*ld and friends will perish.”
This*p is what the Lord*s says: “Look,*pn an army is coming from*ld the land of the north; a*ln great nation is being stirred up from*ld the ends of the earth.

They*ln are armed with bow and spear; they*ld are cruel and show no mercy. They*ln sound like the roaring sea as*ld they ride on their horses; they*ln come like men in battle formation to*ld attack you, Daughter Zion.”
We*pn have heard reports about them, and*ld our hands hang limp. Anguish*ln has gripped us, pain*ld like that of a woman in labor.
Do*ln not go out to the fields or*ld walk on the roads, for*ln the enemy has a sword, and*ld there is terror on every side.
Put*ln on sackcloth, my people, and*ld roll in ashes; mourn*ln with bitter wailing as*ld for an only son, for*ln suddenly the destroyer will*ld come upon us.
“I*pn have made you a tester of metals and*ld my people the ore, that*ln you may observe and*ld test their ways.
They*ln are all hardened rebels, going*ld about to slander. They*ln are bronze and iron; they*ld all act corruptly.
The*ln bellows blow fiercely to*ld burn away the lead with fire, but*ln the refining goes on in vain; the*ld wicked are not purged out.
They*ln are called rejected silver, because*ld the Lord*s has rejected them.”
